definitions.structures.euclidean.vectorspaces

Interface EuclideanSpace

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Group, InnerProductSpace, MetricSpace, Monoid, NormedSpace, SemiGroup, java.io.Serializable, VectorSpace, VectorSpaceMethods, XmlPrintable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DiscreetField, EuclideanAlgebra, EuclideanFunctionSpace, Field, FiniteDomain, FiniteField, FinitePrimeField, ParameterizedSpace, PrimeField
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComplexPlane, FiniteDimensionalFunctionSpace, FiniteDimensionalSobolevSpace, FiniteDimensionalVectorSpace, FunctionalSpace, PolynomialFunctionSpace, QuaternionSpace, RealLine, TrigonometricSobolevSpace, TrigonometricSpace

    public interface EuclideanSpace
extends InnerProductSpace, VectorSpaceMethods
    Author:
    RoManski An euclidean vector space is a finite dimensional hilbert space. It is equipped with a base. The norm can be used to normalize vectors, compute distances between vectors and generate an orthonormal base.
